meanings.definition: Not hostile or aggressive in attitude or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The peaceful dove was unbelligerent towards the other birds.
meanings.sent2: She always remained unbelligerent during disagreements, preferring calm discussions.
meanings.sent3: The unbelligerent kitten refused to play rough with the other pets.
meanings.sent4: His unbelligerent nature was like a soothing balm in the midst of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The clear blue sky seemed unbelligerent, offering a sense of tranquility.

meanings.definition: Showing no inclination to fight or engage in conflict.
meanings.sent1: The shy child was unbelligerent and avoided playground arguments.
meanings.sent2: Despite the taunts, he remained unbelligerent and walked away peacefully.
meanings.sent3: The unbelligerent squirrel simply ignored the noisy crows around.
meanings.sent4: Her unbelligerent stance was like a shield against unnecessary drama.
meanings.sent5: The calm lake reflected an unbelligerent surface, undisturbed by ripples.
